Annotation.String: This is the schema definition of the Memory and its configuration.
This resource shall be used to represent the Memory in a Redfish implementation.
This defines the action for unlocking given regions.
This action shall apply the supplied passphrase to the supplied region for the purpose of unlocking the given regions.
Memory region ID for which this action to be applied.
The value of this property shall be the Memory region ID for which this action to be applied.
Passphrase for doing the operation.
The value of this property shall be the passphrase used in this actionn.
This defines the action for securely erasing given regions using the NIST SP800-88 Purge: Cryptograhic Erase.

This action shall securely erase the supplied region provided the supplied passphrase matches that of the given region using the NIST SP800-88 Purge: Cryptographic Erase. Use the OverwriteUnit method to perform NIST SP800-88 Purge: Overwrite.
Memory region ID for which this action to be applied.
The value of this property shall be the Memory region ID for which this action to be applied.
Passphrase for doing the operation.
The value of this property shall be the passphrase used in this action.
This defines the action for securely erasing given regions using the NIST SP800-88 Purge: Overwrite.

This action shall securely erase the supplied region provided the supplied passphrase matches that of the given region using the NIST SP800-88 Purge: Overwrite. Use the SecureEraseUnit method to perform NIST SP800-88 Purge: Cryptographic Erase.
Memory region ID for which this action to be applied.
The value of this property shall be the Memory region ID for which this action to be applied.
Passphrase for doing the operation.
The value of this property shall be the passphrase used in this action.
Set passphrase for the given regions.
This action shall apply the supplied passphrase to the supplied region.
Memory region ID for which this action to be applied.
The value of this property shall be the Memory region ID for which this action to be applied.
Passphrase for doing the operation.
The value of this property shall be the passphrase used in this action.
Disable passphrase for given regions.
This action shall disaple the need for passphrases on the supplied region provided the supplied passphrase matches that of the region.
Memory region ID for which this action to be applied.
The value of this property shall be the Memory region ID for which this action to be applied.
Passphrase for doing the operation.
The value of this property shall be the passphrase used in this action.
This is the schema definition for definition of a Memory and its configuration.
The type of Memory.
The value of this property shall be the type of Memory represented by this resource.
Type details of the Memory.
The value of this property shall be the Memory Device Type as defined by SMBIOS.
The base module type of Memory.
The value of this property shall be the base module type of Memory.
Media of this Memory.
The value of this property shall be the media types of this Memory.
Memory Capacity in mebibytes (MiB).
The value of this property shall be the Memory capacity in MiB.
Data Width in bits.
The value of this property shall be the data width in bits.
Bus Width in bits.
The value of this property shall be the bus width in bits.
The Memory manufacturer.
This property shall contain a string which identifies the manufacturer of the Memory.
The product serial number of this device.
This property shall indicate the serial number as provided by the manufacturer of this Memory.
The product part number of this device.
This property shall indicate the part number as provided by the manufacturer of this Memory.
Speed bins supported by this Memory.
The value of this property shall be the speed supported by this Memory.
Revision of firmware on the Memory controller.
The value of this property shall be the revision of firmware on the Memory controller.
Version of API supported by the firmware.
The value of this property shall be the version of API supported by the firmware.
Function Classes by the Memory.
The value of this property shall be the function classes by the Memory.

PropertyValue.String: This property has been Deprecated in favor of OperatingMemoryModes at the root of the resource, or MemoryClassification found within RegionSet.

Annotation.String: Vendor ID.
The value of this property shall be the vendor ID of the Memory.

PropertyValue.String: This property has been Deprecated in favor of ModuleManufacturerID.

Annotation.String: Device ID.
The value of this property shall be the device ID of the Memory.

PropertyValue.String: This property has been Deprecated in favor of ModuleProductID.

Annotation.String: SubSystem Vendor ID.
The value of this property shall be the subsystem Vendor ID of the Memory.

PropertyValue.String: This property has been Deprecated in favor of MemorySubsystemControllerManufacturerID.

Annotation.String: Subsystem Device ID.
The value of this property shall be the subsystem Device ID of the Memory.

PropertyValue.String: This property has been Deprecated in favor of MemorySubsystemControllerProductID.

Annotation.String: Maximum TDPs in milli Watts.
The value of this property shall be the maximum power budgets supported by the Memory in milli Watts.
This object contains security capabilities of the Memory.
This object shall contain properties which describe the security capabilities of the Memory.
Number of unused spare devices available in the Memory.
The value of this property shall be the number of unused spare devices available in the Memory. If memory devices fails, the spare device could be used.
Number of ranks available in the Memory.
The value of this property shall be number of ranks available in the Memory. The ranks could be used for spare or interleave.
Location of the Memory in the platform.
The value of this property shall be location of the Memory in the platform, typically marked in the silk screen.
Memory connection information to sockets and memory controllers.
This object shall contain properties which describe the Memory connection information to sockets and memory controllers.
Error correction scheme supported for this memory.
The value of this property shall be the error correction scheme supported for this memory.
Operating speed of Memory in MHz or MT/s as appropriate.

The value of this property shall be the operating speed of Memory in MHz or MT/s (mega-transfers per second) as reported by the memory device. Memory devices which operate at their bus speed shall report the operating speed in MHz (bus speed), while memory device which transfer data faster than their bus speed (e.g. DDR memory) shall report the operating speed in MT/s (mega-transfers/second). In any case, the reported value shall match the conventionally reported values for the technology utilized by the memory device.
Total size of volatile regions in mebibytes (MiB).
The value of this property shall be the total size of volatile regions in MiB.
Total size of persistent regions in mebibytes (MiB).
The value of this property shall be the total size of persistent regions in MiB.
Memory regions information within the Memory.
The value of this property shall be the memory region information within the Memory.
Memory modes supported by the Memory.
The value of this property shall be the memory modes supported by the Memory.
Power management policy information.
This object shall contain properties which describe the power management policy for the current resource.
Spare device enabled status.
The value of this property shall be true if a spare device is enabled for this Memory.
Rank spare enabled status.
The value of this property shall be true if a rank spare is enabled for this Memory.
A reference to the Metrics associated with this Memory.
A reference to the Metrics associated with this Memory.
The available actions for this resource.
The Actions property shall contain the available actions for this resource.
The memory module is composed of volatile memory.
This memory type shall represent volatile DRAM.
The memory module is composed of volatile memory backed by non-volatile memory.
This memory type shall represent NVDIMM_N as defined by JEDEC.
The memory module is composed of non-volatile memory.
This memory type shall represent NVDIMM_F as defined by JEDEC.
The memory module is composed of a combination of non-volatile and volatile memory.
This memory type shall represent NVDIMM_P as defined by JEDEC.
The memory module is Intel Optane DC Persistent Memory and composed of a combination of non-volatile and volatile memory.
This memory type shall represent Intel Optane DC Persistent Memory.
DDR4 SDRAM.
DDR4E SDRAM.
LPDDR4 SDRAM.
DDR3 SDRAM.
LPDDR3 SDRAM.
DDR2 SDRAM.
DDR2 SDRAM FB_DIMM.
DDR2 SDRAM FB_DIMM PROBE.
DDR SGRAM.
DDR SDRAM.
Fast Page Mode.
Pipelined Nibble.
Logical Non-volatile device.
High Bandwidth Memory.
High Bandwidth Memory 2.
Registered DIMM.
Load Reduced.
A die within a package.
DRAM media.
NAND media.
Intel 3D XPoint media.
Proprietary media.
This type contains security capabilities of a Memory entity.
This type shall contain properties which describe the security capabilities of a Memory entity.
Memory passphrase set capability.
Memory passphrase set capability.
Maximum number of passphrases supported for this Memory.
Maximum number of passphrases supported for this Memory.
Security states supported by the Memory.
Security states supported by the Memory.

PropertyValue.String: This property has been deprecated in favor of using the individual PassphraseCapable, DataLockCapable and ConfigurationLockCapable properties.

Annotation.String: Secure mode is enabled and access to the data is allowed.
Secure mode is disabled.
Secure mode is enabled and access to the data is unlocked.

PropertyValue.String: This value has been deprecated in favor of 'Enabled' to indicate normal security operation.

Annotation.String: Secure mode is enabled and access to the data is locked.
Secure state is frozen and can not be modified until reset.

PropertyValue.String: This value has been deprecated in favor of using the ConfigurationLocked to indicate that the configuration has been frozen.

Annotation.String: Number of attempts to unlock the Memory exceeded limit.
Memory connection information to sockets and memory controllers.
This type shall contain properties which describe the Memory connection information to sockets and memory controllers.
Socket number in which Memory is connected.
Socket number in which Memory is connected.
Memory controller number in which Memory is connected.
Memory controller number in which Memory is connected.
Channel number in which Memory is connected.
Channel number in which Memory is connected.
Slot number in which Memory is connected.
Slot number in which Memory is connected.
No ECC available.
Single bit Data error can be corrected by ECC.
Multi-bit Data errors can be corrected by ECC.
Address Parity errors can be corrected.
Memory region information within a Memory entity.
This type shall describe the memory region information within a Memory entity.
Unique region ID representing a specific region within the Memory.
Unique region ID representing a specific region within the Memory.
Classification of memory occupied by the given memory region.
Classification of memory occupied by the given memory region.
Offset with in the Memory that corresponds to the starting of this memory region in mebibytes (MiB).
Offset with in the Memory that corresponds to the starting of this memory region in MiB.
Size of this memory region in mebibytes (MiB).
Size of this memory region in MiB.
State of the passphrase for this region.
State of the passphrase for this region.

PropertyValue.String: This property has been Deprecated in favor of PassphraseEnabled found within RegionSet.

Annotation.String: Volatile memory.
Byte accessible persistent memory.
Block accesible memory.
Volatile memory.
Persistent memory, byte accesible through system address space.
Block accessible system memory.
Power management policy information.
This type shall contain properties which describe the power management policy for the current resource.
Power management policy enabled status.
Power management policy enabled status.
Maximum TDP in milli watts.
Maximum TDP in milli watts.
Peak power budget in milli watts.
Peak power budget in milli watts.
Average power budget in milli watts.
Average power budget in milli watts.
The available actions for this resource.
This type shall contain the available actions for this resource.
This property contains the available OEM specific actions for this resource.
This property shall contain any additional OEM actions for this resource.
The available OEM specific actions for this resource.
This type shall contain any additional OEM actions for this resource.
This version was created to show annotations in previous namespaces were updated.
This version was created to show annotations in previous namespaces were updated.
This version was created to add requirements on the action parameters to show they are mandatory via Nullable=false. It was also created to update the description of OperatingSpeedMHz.

This version was created to add Units annotations on various properties. It was also created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that OData properties are marked as required, and integer properties are marked as integer rather than number.
This version was created to make use of the new Revisions annotation.
This property describes the status and health of the resource and its children.
This property shall contain any status or health properties of the resource.
This version was created to show annotations in previous namespaces were updated.
This version was created to add requirements on the action parameters to show they are mandatory via Nullable=false. It was also created to update the description of OperatingSpeedMHz.

This version was created to add Units annotations on various properties. It was also created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that OData properties are marked as required, and integer properties are marked as integer rather than number.
This version was created to make use of the new Revisions annotation.
Total number of volatile regions this Memory can support.
The value of this property shall be the total number of volatile regions this Memory can support.
Total number of persistent regions this Memory can support.
The value of this property shall be the total number of persistent regions this Memory can support.
Maximum size of a single volatile region in mebibytes (MiB).
The value of this property shall be the maximum size of a single volatile regions in MiB.
Maximum size of a single persistent region in mebibytes (MiB).
The value of this property shall be the maximum size of a single persistent regions in MiB.
The size of the smallest unit of allocation for a memory region in mebibytes (MiB).
The value of this property shall be the allocation increment for regions, measured in MiB.
The boundary which memory regions are allocated on, measured in mebibytes (MiB).
The value of this property shall be thealignment boundary on which memory regions are allocated, measured in MiB.
Contains references to other resources that are related to this resource.
The Links property, as described by the Redfish Specification, shall contain references to resources that are related to, but not contained by (subordinate to), this resource.
Contains references to other resources that are related to this resource.
This type, as described by the Redfish Specification, shall contain references to resources that are related to, but not contained by (subordinate to), this resource.
A reference to the Chassis which contains this Memory.
The value of this property shall be a reference to a resource of type Chassis that represent the physical container associated with this Memory.
This version was created to add requirements on the action parameters to show they are mandatory via Nullable=false. It was also created to update the description of OperatingSpeedMHz.

This version was created to add Units annotations on various properties. It was also created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that OData properties are marked as required, and integer properties are marked as integer rather than number.
This version was created to make use of the new Revisions annotation.
The manufacturer ID of this memory module.
The value of this property shall be the two byte manufacturer ID of this memory module as defined by JEDEC in JEP-106.
The product ID of this memory module.
The value of this property shall be the two byte product ID of this memory module as defined by the manufacturer.
The manufacturer ID of the memory subsystem controller of this memory module.
The value of this property shall be the two byte manufacturer ID of the memory subsystem controller of this memory module as defined by JEDEC in JEP-106.
The product ID of the memory subsystem controller of this memory module.
The value of this property shall be the two byte product ID of the memory subsystem controller of this memory module as defined by the manufacturer.
This version was created to add requirements on the action parameters to show they are mandatory via Nullable=false. It was also created to update the description of OperatingSpeedMHz.

This version was created to add Units annotations on various properties. It was also created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that OData properties are marked as required, and integer properties are marked as integer rather than number.
This version was created to make use of the new Revisions annotation.
Total size of the volitile portion memory in MiB.
The value of this property shall be the total size of the volatile portion memory in MiB.
Total size of the non-volatile portion memory in MiB.
The value of this property shall be the total size of the non-volatile portion memory in MiB.
Total size of the cache portion memory in MiB.
The value of this property shall be the total size of the cache portion memory in MiB.
Total size of the logical memory in MiB.
The value of this property shall be the total size of the logical memory in MiB.
The Location of the memory.
This property shall contain location information of the associated memory.
A reference to the Assembly resource associated with this memory.
The value of this property shall be a link to a resource of type Assembly.
This version was created to update descriptions to match the editorial style used in other Redfish schemas.

This version was created to add Units annotations on various properties. It was also created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that OData properties are marked as required, and integer properties are marked as integer rather than number.
This version was created to make use of the new Revisions annotation.
Indicates if the passphrase is enabled for this region.
The value of this property shall be a boolean indicating if the passphrase is enabled for this region.

This version was created to add Units annotations on various properties. It was also created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that OData properties are marked as required, and integer properties are marked as integer rather than number.
This version was created to make use of the new Revisions annotation.
This version was created to change the LongDescription of SecureEraseUnit. It was also created to define a new OverwriteUnit action. It also adds IntelOptane to the MemoryType list.
This version was created to make use of the new Revisions annotation.

This version was created to add 3DXPoint to the MediaType enum. It was also created to add SecurityState, add ConfigurationLocked, add 3DXPoint to the MediaType enumerations, and to replace SecurityStates with individual capability properties.
The current security state of this Memory.
The value of this property shall be the current security state of this memory.
Indicates that the configuration of this memory has been locked.

The value of this property shall be the current configuration lock state of this memory. True shall indicate that the configuration is locked and cannot be altered. False shall indicate that the configuration is not locked and may be altered.
Support for locking the configuration.
The value of this property shall indicate whether this memory supports the locking (freezing) of the configuration.
Support for data locking.
The value of this property shall indicate whether this memory supports the locking of data access.
Maximum number of incorrect passphrase attempts allowed before memory is locked.

The value of this property shall be the maximum number of incorrect passphase access attempts allowed before access to data is locked. A value of zero shall indicate that there is no limit to the number of attempts.
